metadata.name: Echo of war
metadata.description:
There are many things in the world that impose only positive emotions. You imagine how that thing or mechanism was created, how much use it made to people. 

You can't say that about military equipment.

I've never been a fan of military museums. When I was a kid I was in a military-patriotic club. There we disassembled machine guns, went to the firing range, learned to be courageous, jumped with a parachute. Now I would smack my parents for that.

These are the surviving guns on the Barents Sea shore of the 1940s.
These installations caused me unpleasant emotions, fear, panic. The war is over, the countries are at peace, but the guns are remembered...

Translated with www.DeepL.com/Translator (free version)
